case_vignette: A 13-month-old toddler with spreading eczema on his trunk and arms is brought in by his mother! She is applying moisturizer and a cortisone cream! However, 2 days earlier, a wound appeared on his left hand that appears to be infected! Since then, more areas of raw, oozing skin have developed! Examination reveals lichenified scaling plaques scattered on the trunk and posterior knees and arms, and his left arm has monomorphic crusted vesicles and ulcerations on an erythematous base!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have spreading eczema on my trunk and arms, and a wound on my left hand that looks infected. There are also more areas of raw, oozing skin that have developed recently.
How long have you had these symptoms?
The spreading eczema has been there a while, but the wound on my hand and the raw, oozing skin started 2 days ago.
Have you recently started taking any new medications or come into contact with any new substances or allergens?
I haven't started any new medications or come into contact with new substances or allergens recently.
Do you have any fever, chills, or other signs of infection?
No, I do not have any fever, chills, or other signs of infection.
Have you ever had a similar skin condition in the past, or is there any family history of skin diseases?
The case vignette does not provide information about past similar conditions or family history of skin diseases.
Do you have a history of allergies or atopic conditions like asthma or hay fever?
The case vignette does not provide information about a history of allergies or atopic conditions like asthma or hay fever.
Has the wound on your hand been exposed to water or kept in a moist environment frequently?
The case vignette does not specify if the wound on my hand has been exposed to water or kept in a moist environment.
Final Diagnosis: Eczema herpeticum
